result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric W Morehead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must be compliant with any child support obligations in family or paternity court.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: JOC AMENDED TO IMPOSE 60 DAYS CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME. THERE IS TO BE NO HUBER AND NO GOOD TIME ON THIS CONDITIONAL TIME.

Defendant Eric W Morehead in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Eric W Morehead in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
DOC requests 60 days conditional jail time be imposed by the Court. The defense does not object to the request of DOC. The State is deferential to the Court's original sentence and should any additional sentence be imposed, the State does not object

BTC: The request of DOC is granted. All previous terms and conditions of JOC remain. 60 days conditional time is ordered - without huber and without good time.

Defendant Eric W Morehead in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
ZCI
Defendants
Carolyn Delery
Preliminary hearing on April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendants.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Eric W Morehead in court with attorney Ahmed Jenkins.  Defendant Eric W Morehead in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
